page.title: 01Farm/Marshland Isle of Grain
page.content: Area mainly consists of marshland adjacent to sea. A yacht club is raised in Colemouth Creek which is also a favourite haven for anglers. A particularly large type of lugworm is found on mudflats to their delight. An oil distribution centre, a gas stoppage installation & a bitumen producing plant with road & rail marshalling yards are the sole industries, apart from farming. A quarter of the area is arable farmland. The main crops from which are barley, oats & wheat together with the occasional field of green vegetables. Block engulfed by network of fleets (local description for water filled ditches). Two thirds of the land is littered with concrete foundations from an extinct oil refinery.
